name: WP PostVoting
author: Realwebcare

sections.description:
“WP PostVoting” plugin will make your wordpress blog a content voting site and also create a widget to display the most voted posts. Using the power of the ajax, users will be able to vote any posts instantly. From the admin panel you can decide whether you would like to allow or disallow unregistered users to vote.

Demo

View the DEMO of the plugin.

Features

  • Control voting system via PostVoting Active/Inactive option.
  • Allowing only Registered users to vote.
  • Customise PostVoting text.
  • Sort posts by vote count.
  • Display PostVoting statistics.
  • Display most voted widget in sidebar.

Usage

  • Install and activate the plugin.
  • Go to your Dashboard and navigate to “Settings >> WP PostVoting”.
  • Activate PostVoting and also mark where you would like to show PostVoting count.
  • Allow or disallow unregistered visitors to vote.
  • Drag and drop ‘WPPV Most Voted Posts’ widget in your sidebar to display most voted posts.

Credits

  • Website: Realwebcare
  • Facebook Page

Note

  • Please rate this plugin and leave comment or suggestion.
  • It will help me to review and improve the quality of this plugin.

sections.installation:
1. Upload the whole plugin folder to your /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Install and activate the plugin.
  3. Go to Settings >> WP PostVoting and Activate the voting feature.
  4. Go to: Appearance >> Widgets.
  5. Drag and drop ‘WPPV Most Voted Posts’ widget in your sidebar to display most voted posts.
